gw.api.util

Class DateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.DateUtil

  • public class DateUtil
extends Object
    Provides date manipulation and calculation utilities.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Date BusinessDayEnd
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the end of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.
      static Date BusinessDayStart
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the start of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.
      static int BusinessWeekEnd
      Return the business day end as an integer. The integers are mapped as follows:

      0 indicates no end of business week was configured 1 indicates Sunday 2 indicates Monday 3 indicates Tuesday 4 indicates Wednesday 5 indicates Thursday 6 indicates Friday 7 indicates Saturday

      As specified by {@link java.util.GregorianCalendar#SUNDAY}, etc.
      static Date[] ConfiguredHolidays
      Return the days configured to be holidays for the system.

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, Zone location)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, Address location)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.
      static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of business days to the given date. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, Zone location)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.
      static Date addDays(Date date, int iDays)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of days to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 days from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addDays( date, -5 ).
      static Date addHours(Date date, int iHours)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of hours to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 hours from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addHours( date, -5 ).
      static Date addMinutes(Date date, int iMinutes)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of minutes to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 minutes from the current time of the date, you can achieve it by calling: addMinutes( date, -5 ).
      static Date addMonths(Date date, int iMonths)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of months to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 months from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addMonths( date, -5 ).
      static Date addSeconds(Date date, int iSeconds)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of seconds to the given date.
      static Date addWeeks(Date date, int iWeeks)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of weeks to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 weeks from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addWeeks( date, -5 ).
      static Date addYears(Date date, int iYears)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of years to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 years from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addYears( date, -5 ).
      static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Zone location)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Address location)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.
      static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.
      static int compareIgnoreTime(Date date1, Date date2)
      Compares only the date components of two dates, the time component is ignored.
      static Date createDateInstance(int month, int day, int year)
      Creates a new Date instance initialized to the specified month, day and year.
      static Date currentDate()
      Returns the current date.
      static int daysBetween(Date date1, Date date2)
      Returns number of days between two dates. Note that this method returns an absolute value, i.e., the order of the arguments does not matter. This is as opposed to {@link #differenceInDays(java.util.Date, java.util.Date)}, which returns a true difference.
      static int daysSince(Date date)
      Returns the number of days elapsed since a given time.
      static int differenceInDays(Date dateStart, Date dateEnd)
      Returns the difference between dateEnd at midnight and dateStart at midnight, in days.
      static Date endOfDay(Date date)
      Given a date, returns a new date whose time component is set to the last millisecond before the next day (in the current time zone) starts.
      static String format(Date date, String dateComponent, String timeComponent)
      Converts a Date to a String. Allowable values for dateComponent and timeComponent are "long", "medium", "short".
      static String formatAsJapaneseImperialDate(Date date, DateTimeFormat formatType, boolean withTime)
      If Japanese Imperial Calendar is available, converts date to an output string in Japanese Imperial Calendar format
      static Date getBusinessDayEnd()
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the end of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.
      static Date getBusinessDayStart()
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the start of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.
      static boolean[] getBusinessDaysAsBooleanArray(Object zoneTag)
      Return an array seven of booleans where each boolean indicates whether the corresponding day is considered a business day. The array is laid out like so:
      static int getBusinessWeekEnd()
      Return the business day end as an integer. The integers are mapped as follows:

      0 indicates no end of business week was configured 1 indicates Sunday 2 indicates Monday 3 indicates Tuesday 4 indicates Wednesday 5 indicates Thursday 6 indicates Friday 7 indicates Saturday

      As specified by {@link java.util.GregorianCalendar#SUNDAY}, etc.
      static Date[] getConfiguredHolidays(HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Return the days configured to be holidays under a certain holiday tag code.

      Return the days configured to be holidays for a certain location.

      Return the days configured to be holidays for the system.

      Get the hour of the time, base on a 12-hour clock.

      Get the hour of the time, based on a 24-hour clock.

      Get the minute of the given date

      The month of the year.

      Gets the name of the given month.

      Get the week of month.

      Get the week of the year.
      static int getYear(Date date)
      Get the year.
      static String getYearFromString(String yearString)
      Get the year from a string of digits. Always returns a four-digit year. Will convert a two-digit year into a four-digit year. Two digit years are resolved using the TwoDigitYearThreshold configuration parameter.
      static int hoursSince(Date date)
      Returns the number of hours elapsed since a given time.
      static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, Address location)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, Zone location)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, HolidayTagCode tag)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day. The default business week zone will be used.
      static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, HolidayTagCode tag, Object businessWeekZone)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      static Date mergeDateAndTime(Date dateSource, Date timeSource)
      Merges the date component of dateSource with the time component of timeSource.
      static int minutesSince(Date date)
      Returns the number of minutes elapsed since a given time.
      static int secondsSince(Date date)
      Returns the number of seconds elapsed since a given time.
      static Date trimToMidnight(Date date)
      Trim the given date to midnight. That is to say, set days, hours, minutes, seconds, and millis to zero.
      static Boolean verifyDateOnOrAfterToday(Date date)
      Used to validate whether the date selected is on or after today. Returns null if date is null.

    • Field Detail

      • BusinessDayEnd

        Date BusinessDayEnd
        Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the end of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

        NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

      • BusinessDayStart

        Date BusinessDayStart
        Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the start of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

        NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

      • BusinessWeekEnd

        int BusinessWeekEnd
        Return the business day end as an integer. The integers are mapped as follows:

        • 0 indicates no end of business week was configured
        • 1 indicates Sunday
        • 2 indicates Monday
        • 3 indicates Tuesday
        • 4 indicates Wednesday
        • 5 indicates Thursday
        • 6 indicates Friday
        • 7 indicates Saturday

        As specified by {@link java.util.GregorianCalendar#SUNDAY}, etc.

      • ConfiguredHolidays

        Date[] ConfiguredHolidays
        Return the days configured to be holidays for the system.

    • Method Detail

      • addBusinessDays

        Date addBusinessDays(Date date,
                   int iDays,
                   HolidayTagCode tagCode,
                   Object businessWeekZone)
        Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

        Parameters:
        date - The date.
        iDays - The number of business days to add.
        tagCode - The holiday tag code.
        businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
        Returns:
        A new date with the business days added.

      • addBusinessDays

        Date addBusinessDays(Date date,
                   int iDays,
                   Zone location)
        Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

        Parameters:
        date - The date.
        iDays - The number of business days to add.
        location - The location.
        Returns:
        A new date with the business days added.

      • addDays

        Date addDays(Date date,
           int iDays)
        Adds the specified (signed) amount of days to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 days from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addDays( date, -5 ).
        Parameters:
        date - The time.
        iDays - The amount of days to add.
        Returns:
        A new date with the days added.

        A new date with the hours added.

      • businessDaysBetween

        int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate,
                      Date toDate,
                      Zone location)
        Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

        Parameters:
        fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
        toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
        location - The location.
        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

      • businessDaysBetween

        int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate,
                      Date toDate,
                      Address location)
        Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

        Parameters:
        fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
        toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
        location - The location.
        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

      • businessDaysBetween

        int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate,
                      Date toDate,
                      HolidayTagCode tagCode,
                      Object businessWeekZone)
        Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

        Parameters:
        fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
        toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
        tagCode - The holiday tag code.
        businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

      • businessDaysBetween

        int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate,
                      Date toDate,
                      HolidayTagCode tagCode)

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

        toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
        tagCode - The holiday tag code.
        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

                       Date toDate,

                       Object businessWeekZone)
        Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

      • businessHoursBetween

        int businessHoursBetween(Date fromDate,
                       Date toDate,
                       HolidayTagCode tagCode)
        Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

        Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

        Parameters:
        fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
        toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
        tagCode - The holiday tag code.
        Returns:
        The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

      • compareIgnoreTime

        int compareIgnoreTime(Date date1,
                    Date date2)
        Compares only the date components of two dates, the time component is ignored.
        Parameters:
        date1 - The date.
        date2 - The date to compare against.
        Returns:
        The value 0 if date1 equals date; a value less than 0 if date1 is less than date2; and a value greater than 0 if date1 is greater than date2.

      • createDateInstance

        Date createDateInstance(int month,
                      int day,
                      int year)
        Creates a new Date instance initialized to the specified month, day and year.
        Parameters:
        month - month
        day - day
        year - year
        Returns:
        a Date.

      • currentDate

        Date currentDate()
        Returns the current date.
        Returns:
        The current date.

      • daysBetween

        int daysBetween(Date date1,
              Date date2)
        Returns number of days between two dates. Note that this method returns an absolute value, i.e., the order of the arguments does not matter. This is as opposed to {@link #differenceInDays(java.util.Date, java.util.Date)}, which returns a true difference.
        Parameters:
        date1 -
        date2 -
        Returns:
        The number of days between the two dates. The number is the absolute value of the difference in days.

      • daysSince

        int daysSince(Date date)
        Returns the number of days elapsed since a given time.
        Parameters:
        date - The time.
        Returns:
        The number of days elapsed since the time.

      • differenceInDays

        int differenceInDays(Date dateStart,
                   Date dateEnd)
        Returns the difference between dateEnd at midnight and dateStart at midnight, in days.
        Parameters:
        dateStart - The start date.
        dateEnd - The end date.
        Returns:
        The difference between dateEnd and dateStart, in days. The result is positive if dateStart comes before dateEnd (ignoring time); negative if dateStart comes after dateEnd (ignoring time); zero if the two dates are the same (ignoring time)

        Parameters:
        date -
        Returns:

        timeComponent -

      • formatAsJapaneseImperialDate

        String formatAsJapaneseImperialDate(Date date,
                                  DateTimeFormat formatType,
                                  boolean withTime)
        If Japanese Imperial Calendar is available, converts date to an output string in Japanese Imperial Calendar format
        Parameters:
        date - the Date to convert to a String
        formatType - the format of the output, if none is specified then "SHORT" is assumed
        withTime - whether to output the time part of the date
        Returns:
        date in Japanese Imperial Calendar format, if Japanese Imperial Calendar is available

      • getBusinessDayEnd

        Date getBusinessDayEnd()
        Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the end of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

        NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

        Returns:

      • getBusinessDayStart

        Date getBusinessDayStart()
        Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the start of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

        NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

        Returns:

      • getBusinessDaysAsBooleanArray

        boolean[] getBusinessDaysAsBooleanArray(Object zoneTag)
        Return an array seven of booleans where each boolean indicates whether the corresponding day is considered a business day. The array is laid out like so:

        Parameters:
        zoneTag - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.


        [Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday]

        Returns:

      • getBusinessWeekEnd

        int getBusinessWeekEnd()
        Return the business day end as an integer. The integers are mapped as follows:

        • 0 indicates no end of business week was configured
        • 1 indicates Sunday
        • 2 indicates Monday
        • 3 indicates Tuesday
        • 4 indicates Wednesday
        • 5 indicates Thursday
        • 6 indicates Friday
        • 7 indicates Saturday

        As specified by {@link java.util.GregorianCalendar#SUNDAY}, etc.

        Returns:

      • getYearFromString

        String getYearFromString(String yearString)
        Get the year from a string of digits. Always returns a four-digit year. Will convert a two-digit year into a four-digit year. Two digit years are resolved using the TwoDigitYearThreshold configuration parameter.
        Parameters:
        yearString - java.lang.String representation of a year, either two digits or four digits.
        Returns:
        The four-digit representation of a year. Returns null if the input java.lang.String was invalid.

      • mergeDateAndTime

        Date mergeDateAndTime(Date dateSource,
                    Date timeSource)
        Merges the date component of dateSource with the time component of timeSource.
        Parameters:
        dateSource - the day (MM/dd/yyyy) to merge; time part is ignored.
        timeSource - the time (hh:mm:ss.SSS) to merge; date part is ignored.
        Returns:
        a new Date containing the date componenent of dateSource combined with the time component of timeSource.

      • trimToMidnight

        Date trimToMidnight(Date date)
        Trim the given date to midnight. That is to say, set days, hours, minutes, seconds, and millis to zero.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a Date without any time component.

      • verifyDateOnOrAfterToday

        Boolean verifyDateOnOrAfterToday(Date date)
        Used to validate whether the date selected is on or after today. Returns null if date is null.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to be validated
        Returns:
        true if the given date is equal to or later than the start of day today.
